equipment->Lute.name: Lute
equipment->Lute.description: Handheld instruments include bagpipes, a small set of chimes, small drums, fiddles and viols, flutes and recorders, small harps, lutes, trumpets, and similarly sized instruments. The GM might rule that an especially large handheld instrument (like a tuba) has greater Bulk. Heavy instruments such as large drums, a full set of chimes, and keyboard instruments are less portable and generally need to be stationary while played.

action->Cruel Performance.name: Cruel Performance
action->Cruel Performance.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The bard makes cruel, cutting comments that draw blood. All enemies within 30 feet take @Damage[7d6[slashing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:24|basic] save).

Clockwork Dancers.name: Clockwork Dancers
Clockwork Dancers.descriptionHazard: Several clockwork humanoid figures armed with spinning blades move throughout the area.
Clockwork Dancers.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:25|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to deactivate the clockworks from the control panel. Two successes are needed to deactivate the trap.
Clockwork Dancers.reset: The trap deactivates after 4 rounds and resets after 1 minute.
Clockwork Dancers.routine: (1 action) The clockwork dancers target each creature on the stage within 10 feet of a pillar by a spinning blade Strike.

action->Spring Attack.name: Spring Attack
action->Spring Attack.description:
Trigger A creature ends its turn in F2

Effect Clockwork figures spring out from the pillars and attack anyone on the stage with a spinning blade Strike. The trap then rolls initiative.

Corrupted Draft.name: Corrupted Draft
Corrupted Draft.descriptionHazard: Discordant music, dance, and poetry combine to build a deep suspicion and distrust of strangers.
Corrupted Draft.disable: @Check[performance|dc:28] to counteract the performance or @Check[religion|dc:28] or @Check[occult|dc:28] to disrupt the spiritual energy. Two total successes are needed to disable the trap. The mechanical head can automatically disable the trap with two uses of Inspired Recitation.
Corrupted Draft.reset: The hazard stops when there are no conscious creatures in area E3 and resets after 1 minute.
Corrupted Draft.routine:
(1 action; emotion, fear, mental, occult) The echoes continue to reverberate, tearing at those in the area and filling them with distrust of others. All creatures in the area take @Damage[(2d10+11)[mental]] damage and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:28|traits:emotion,fear,mental,occult,damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is immune to the effects for 1 minute.

Success The target takes half damage.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} by feelings of distrust and anxiety.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

action->Sickening Performance.name: Sickening Performance
action->Sickening Performance.description:
Trigger Two or more characters enter area E3 and make any sound at all

Effect Sounds or speech are amplified and garbled into a terrible, shrieking cry. All creatures in the area take @Damage[(2d10+11)[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:28|basic] save). The trap then rolls initiative.

Deadly Workshop.name: Deadly Workshop
Deadly Workshop.hpDetails: to destroy the chains and disable the trap
Deadly Workshop.descriptionHazard: Swinging bladed chains whip through the entire workshop.
Deadly Workshop.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) on the control panel on the raised platform deactivates the trap.
Deadly Workshop.reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 minute.
Deadly Workshop.routine: (1 action) The trap swings one slashing blade against every creature in the workshop as 1 action. The entire workshop is treated as difficult terrain because of the sheer number of slashing chains. This trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
Deadly Workshop.stealth: (expert) to notice the blades embedded in the chains and the complex system of pulleys connecting them

action->Swinging Blades.name: Swinging Blades
action->Swinging Blades.description:
Trigger Two or more creatures enter the workshop or end their turn in the workshop

Effect The trap makes a slashing blade Strike against the triggering creatures, then rolls initiative.

action->No MAP.name: No MAP
action->No MAP.description: This trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.

Entangling Shredder Trap.name: Entangling Shredder Trap
Entangling Shredder Trap.hpDetails: to cut the barbed ropes and disable the trap
Entangling Shredder Trap.descriptionHazard: Dozens of ropes embedded with steel barbs spring out from the walls when at least two creatures step on the rugs.
Entangling Shredder Trap.stealth: (expert) to notice the pressure plates under the rugs

action->Entangling Ropes.name: Entangling Ropes
action->Entangling Ropes.description:
Trigger Two creatures enter the hallway or end their turn in the hallway

Effect The trap makes a barbed rope Strike against the triggering creatures. This trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.

action->Grasping Ropes.name: Grasping Ropes
action->Grasping Ropes.description:
The ropes whip around the limbs of the target. The target must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:25] save.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until it cuts the ropes or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 25).

Critical Failure As failure, but the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}.

action->No MAP.name: No MAP
action->No MAP.description: This trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.

equipment->Religious Symbol (Wooden).name: Religious Symbol (Wooden)
equipment->Religious Symbol (Wooden).description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

weapon->Staff of Conjuration.name: Staff of Conjuration
weapon->Staff of Conjuration.description:
This ash staff is decorated with animals; wielding it, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify conjuration magic.

Activate Cast a Spell

Effect You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

  • Cantrip @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uZK2BYzPnxUBnDjr]{Tangle Vine}
  • 1st @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Summon Construct}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xqmHD8JIjak15lRk]{Phantasmal Minion}
  • 2nd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9XHmC2JgTUIQ1CCm]{Mist}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WPKJOhEihhcIm2uQ]{Marvelous Mount}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Summon Construct}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lpT6LotUaQPfinjj]{Summon Elemental}

Craft Requirements Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

equipment->Religious Symbol (Wooden).name: Religious Symbol (Wooden)
equipment->Religious Symbol (Wooden).description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

action->Inspired Recitation.name: Inspired Recitation
action->Inspired Recitation.description:
The mechanical assistant recites an inspiring poem, filling allies with determination and vigor. All allies within @Template[emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws and 10 temporary Hit Points for 1 minute. Once an ally has benefited from this ability, they become temporarily immune to Inspired Recitation for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.MT5gxuuxBaN2RdYf]{Effect: Inspired Recitation}

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Noolik deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Sand Wolf.name: Sand Wolf
Sand Wolf.publicNotes:
A sand wolf is an elemental creature which dwells in the sandy deserts of elemental earth that drift to, or have been conjured on, the Plane of Air. Occasionally, these creatures seep through planar rifts or are summoned by elementalists on the Material Plane. Sand wolves are prized as guardians for their relative intelligence, keen perception, and ability to disguise themselves, easily blending with the shifting sands in desert terrain. Cunning and agile, they fiercely pursue any creatures they ambush, no matter how nimble their prey. Sand wolves also have a remarkable ability to sing beautiful, haunting songs, and their music is considered high entertainment among djinn who inhabit the Plane of Air. Many djinni viziers and even certain Material Plane rulers seeking the attention of their peers keep at least one of these creatures in their employ to show off at special events and ceremonies. The wolves' wordless songs evoke both the strength of the earth and the power of wind to erode it.

The Eternal Hourglass

Deep within a cavern in the Plane of Earth is a massive, seemingly indestructible hourglass the size of a small city, its top filled with thousands of sand wolves. As each wolf reaches the opening to the bottom, they are turned to sand and do not reform, instead piling up in a huge mound. It is not clear who constructed or placed the hourglass, how the sand wolves got there, or what—if anything—the hourglass is timing. Some claim the wolves will break loose and rampage freely when the sand runs out, while others believe the glass is counting down to the end of time itself.

action->Collapse Into Sand.name: Collapse Into Sand
action->Collapse Into Sand.description:
Trigger The sand wolf is hit by an attack

Effect The sand wolf's body falls apart into a cloud of sand. It takes no damage from the triggering attack, and its resistances increase to 8. The sand wolf must spend one action to reform its body before it can move or attack.

equipment->Crude Wooden Religious Symbol.name: Crude Wooden Religious Symbol of Sarenrae
equipment->Crude Wooden Religious Symbol.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

Scrapborn.name: Scrapborn
Scrapborn.publicNotes:
In places where magic, alchemy, and engineering converge, there are often unforeseen side effects on the environment and its inhabitants. Scrapborn sometimes result from this strange convergence. Mostly, scrapborn appear to be walking piles of assorted junk, seemingly assembled at random. Their actual bodies are vaguely humanoid with delicate, spongy green skin. They secrete an adhesive that allows them to gather up debris and attach it to their bodies for protection. When these scraps eventually fall off, the scrapborn either reattaches them or replaces them with something new. Despite their resulting bulky appearance, scrapborn remain strong swimmers and display little loss of agility underwater. Scrapborn lack a centralized society, but sometimes congregate in small groups that work together for survival. Typically, this leads to ever-escalating attacks on nearby settlements as the creatures feed upon each other's resentment and work themselves up into a frenzy. They often target places with high-quality armor first so they can improve their odds of survival.

Pretend Knights

Some scrapborn spend a great deal of their time carefully selecting the pieces of armor and other bits they attach to their sticky skin. They might enjoy a particular color or material and cultivate their collection accordingly, striving for a cohesive design over time. A very diligent and patient—or particularly wealthy—scrapborn can even construct a full suit of armor this way and might even be able to pass as a knight, using their bulky armored form to bluff and intimidate anyone who might question them as they walk through a city or castle.

action->Sacrifice Armor.name: Sacrifice Armor
action->Sacrifice Armor.description:
Trigger The scrapborn is damaged by an attack dealing physical damage

Effect The scrapborn directs the damage to one of the pieces of scrap attached to its body and gains resistance 15 against the triggering attack, but its AC is lowered by 2 for 24 hours. The scrapborn's AC cannot be reduced below 16 in this way.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.1wCgwFLJByW8YKyM]{Effect: Sacrifice Armor}

spell->Plane Shift (to Astral Plane, Ele.name: Plane Shift (to Astral Plane, Elemental Planes, or Material Plane only)

action->Elemental Endurance.name: Elemental Endurance
action->Elemental Endurance.description: A janni can survive on any Elemental Plane for up to 48 hours, after which they take [[/r 1]]{1 damage} per hour until they leave or die.

action->Change Size.name: Change Size
action->Change Size.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The janni changes a creature's size. This works as a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wzctak6BxOW8xvFV]{Enlarge} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.PjhUmyKnq6K5uDby]{Shrink} spell but can target an unwilling creature (@Check[fortitude|dc:24] save negates).

The Enmity Cycle.name: The Enmity Cycle
The Enmity Cycle.descriptionHazard: Discordant music, dance, and poetry combine to build a deep suspicion and distrust of strangers.
The Enmity Cycle.disable: @Check[performance|dc:26] to counteract the performance or @Check[religion|dc:27] or @Check[occult|dc:27] to disrupt the spiritual energy. Three total successes are needed to disable the trap.
The Enmity Cycle.reset: A new production of The Enmity Cycle must be arranged; this process usually takes at least 1 week.
The Enmity Cycle.routine:
(1 action) The performance continues to sow seeds of enmity, discord, and distrust on those in its area. All creatures in attendance other than Zridi must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is immune to the effects for 1 day.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} for 2 rounds.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} for 1 minute and is certain the source of this fear is their fellow citizens, especially those from places other than their hometown. For 1 week the target suffers a –2 penalty to all Diplomacy skill checks against people from other Thuvian cities and regains the frightened 2 condition whenever they are in one of those cities.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target becomes a carrier for The Enmity Cycle for the next week. The target is compelled to travel to a city other than where they were exposed and recite as many lines from the anbarit as they can recall. Those who hear or witness the performance are treated as if they had attended a performance of The Enmity Cycle, but with a @Check[will|dc:23] save

action->Discordant Performance.name: Discordant Performance
action->Discordant Performance.description:
Trigger Zridi spends an action to activate The Enmity Cycle while in area F2

Effect All creatures other than Zridi in F2 take @Damage[(2d8+9)[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:25|basic] save). The trap then rolls initiative.

equipment->Religious Symbol of Ahriman.name: Religious Symbol of Ahriman
equipment->Religious Symbol of Ahriman.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

equipment->Musical Instrument (Handheld).name: Musical Instrument (Handheld)
equipment->Musical Instrument (Handheld).description: Handheld instruments include bagpipes, a small set of chimes, small drums, fiddles and viols, flutes and recorders, small harps, lutes, trumpets, and similarly sized instruments. The GM might rule that an especially large handheld instrument (like a tuba) has greater Bulk. Heavy instruments such as large drums, a full set of chimes, and keyboard instruments are less portable and generally need to be stationary while played.

action->Fox's Cunning.name: Fox's Cunning
action->Fox's Cunning.description: A vulpinal's core value is cunning. They can apply their knowledge and stories from their extensive travels to just about any situation in an instant. Before spending any other action on their turn, the vulpinal can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} as a free action.

Zridi.name: Zridi
Zridi.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

equipment->Horn of Fog.name: Horn of Fog
equipment->Horn of Fog.description:
This large ram's horn perpetually glistens with tiny droplets of water, much like condensation.

Activate 2 Interact

Frequency once per hour

Effect You activate the horn by blowing deeply into it, causing it to issue forth a low blast and cast a 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9XHmC2JgTUIQ1CCm]{Mist} spell. You can Dismiss the mist at any time by blowing a second note on the horn using an Interact action.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic
